net.kuujo.copycat.transport

Interface Connection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalConnection, NettyConnection

    public interface Connection
    Transport connection.

    This is a low-level abstraction through which clients and servers communicate with one another once connected. This is more or less a lightweight interface over sockets that supports arbitrary messages.

    Messages sent over a connection must be serializable by the registered Alleycat serializer. This means that messages must implement Serializable, Externalizable, or AlleycatSerializable or provide a custom Serializer.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CompletableFuture<Void> close()
      Closes the connection.

      Sets a close listener on the connection.

      UUID id()
      Returns the connection ID.
      <T,U> CompletableFuture<U> send(T message)
      Sends a message to the other side of the connection.

    • Method Detail

      • id

        UUID id()
        Returns the connection ID.

        The connection ID is inherited from the Client that is connected. When the connection is created, the client will send its Client.id() to the Server and the connection ID will reflect the client's ID on both the client and server side.

        Returns:
        The connection ID.

      • send

        <T,U> CompletableFuture<U> send(T message)
        Sends a message to the other side of the connection.

        The message must be serializable via the configured Alleycat instance. This means it must implement Serializable, Externalizable, or AlleycatSerializable or provide a custom Serializer.

        Note that Connections are bi-directional. That is, messages can be send either by the client or the server. All messages must have a reply, even if the reply is null. Once the reply has been received from the other side of the connection, the returned CompletableFuture will be completed.

        Connection implementations must guarantee that all reply futures will be completed in the same Copycat thread.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The message type.
        U - The reply type.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to send.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed with the response.

      • handler

        <T,U> Connection handler(Class<T> type,
                         MessageHandler<T,U> handler)
        Sets a message handler on the connection.

        The message handler will be invoked each time a message of the given type is received from the other side of the connection. All messages are classified by type, and only one MessageHandler may be registered on the connection for any given type.

        The message handler must return a CompletableFuture to be completed with the message reply. The reply value must be serializable via the configured Alleycat instance. This means it must implement Serializable, Externalizable, or AlleycatSerializable or provide a custom Serializer.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The message type.
        U - The reply type.
        Parameters:
        type - The message type for which to listen. This can be any class that is serializable by the configured Alleycat instance.
        handler - The type-specific message handler.

      • exceptionListener

        ListenerContext<Throwable> exceptionListener(Listener<Throwable> listener)
        Sets an exception listener on the connection.

        In the event of an exception in the connection, the provided listener's Listener.accept(Object) method will be invoked. To unregister the listener, simply ListenerContext.close() the returned ListenerContext.

        Parameters:
        listener - The exception listener.
        Returns:
        The connection.

      • closeListener

        ListenerContext<Connection> closeListener(Listener<Connection> listener)
        Sets a close listener on the connection.

        The provided listener's Listener.accept(Object) method will be invoked when the connection is closed. Note that a close event can be triggered via close() or by the Client or Server that created the connection.

        Parameters:
        listener - The close listener.
        Returns:
        The connection.

      • close

        CompletableFuture<Void> close()
        Closes the connection.

        Once the connection is closed, no more messages can be sent or received by the connection. Any close listeners registered on the connection will be invoked, and the returned CompletableFuture will be completed once the connection has been closed.

        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the connection is closed.
